Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a grey-brown pottery jar, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured burnished slip and faint traces of one line of black-painted hieratic text including a reference to a head bee-keeper (?).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393449) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393449)
